page.title: 02EARLS BARTON - GENERAL
page.content: The village has four churches-Roman Catholic(St.Anselm's),Methodist,Baptist and Church of England (All Saints). There are three Public Houses- The Old Swan,(dating from the 17th Century),The Stags Head,(dating from the 18th Century),and The Boot(19th Century). In addition there are Licenced Clubs- Working Men's,Old Silver Band, and Bowls/Tennis.There are two Restaurants. Two garages are in the survey area. A variety of shops exists including a Chemists,a Cooperative Department Store a Bakery,Butcher,Electrical Goods Store and General Hardware and Garden Centre. Other facilities include Doctors surgeries,a Dentist,Fire Station,Police Station,a Library,an Infant school,a Junior School which feeds Secondary Schools in Wellingborough and a frequent bus service to nearby towns.
